summary_markdown: This data presents a comparative analysis of UK automobile brands, detailing their market penetration and buyer defection rates. Ford leads in penetration at 27%, significantly higher than other brands, while Rover, GM, Nissan, VW/Audi, and Peugeot each hold substantial shares ranging from 16% down to 5%. Brands like Renault, Fiat, Citroen, Toyota, and Honda represent smaller market segments, with penetration rates from 4% down to 1%. Buyer defection rates, however, show a different pattern, with most brands experiencing over 40% defection. Peugeot exhibits the highest defection rate at 57%, followed closely by Honda (53%), Renault (52%), and Fiat and Toyota (both 50%). Rover, GM, and Nissan also show high defection rates above 40%. Ford, despite its high penetration, has a defection rate of 31%, which is lower than the average defection rate of 49% observed across all brands. The structure is comparative, highlighting variations in market performance and customer loyalty among different automobile manufacturers in the UK.
